title: New skin idea: Arcade Azir
body:
I've been looking at the Arcade skins, given they're my personal favorite series of skins (not counting my ultimate skins... heheh). I realize they all seem to match with a specific genre of games.  Here's the list:

**{{champion:103}} : Adventure
{{champion:42}} : Shoot-em-up
{{champion:81}} : Role-playing
{{champion:120}} : Racing (with guitar hero weapon... why not?)
{{champion:21}} : First-person shooter
{{champion:92}} : Fighting
{{champion:37}} : Rhythm**

Now, Azir's playstyle involves calling soldiers to fight for him, as well as building turrets to repel the enemy team.  That sounds like... Real Time Strategy.  Azir is an emperor who leads his armies, which is essentially what a player is in RTS games.  He can call on blocky-style footmen, create square medieval turrets and push enemies with literal shield barricades.  How about it?  Arcade Azir to round off the Arcade series?

**{{champion:268}} : Real-time strategy**

Community ideas (thanks Nightjar):

**{{champion:150}} : Side-scrolling platformer
{{champion:74}} : Tower defense**

replies.body: that's actually pretty clever, well thought out and reasonable. Unfortunately, with the release of jade emporor azir, there probably won't be another azir skin for a while and skins are released in bunches and I doubt there'd be any more niches for arcade skins outside of maybe sidescroller gnar (maybe some sort of crash bandicoot meets mario rip off?) or tower defense heimerdinger (possibly too similar to the azir one though RTS and Tower defense are quite different) and also I don't think riot ever looks at board content, nevermind that sometimes riot forgets OCE is even a region.

Thanks for the support, I was feeling down because of all the "No" votes coming in.  Those are good ideas too, for a total of 10 Arcade skins if they come true.  Gnar getting a power up to become Mega.  {{champion:150}} It's-a Gnario time!  (I'm bad, this post deserves downvotes).

it makes sense from a design point of view, but you have to understand that his animations would not fit the theme very well. if anyone is suited for an **arcade style** skin for being rts, it's heimerdinger. the pixel graphics would fit in better there.

so sure, azir is more RTS-like than heimer, but heimer fits the aesthetic better.

still a good idea tho

I never even noticed that, well done haha

Well its not often that ill say no to a skin for my main :P
and an Arcade theme is far from the worst skin idea for the emperor!
So I think its a great idea!

you have a yes from me!
no other champ could fill that RTS position as well as Azir.

Although I personally i do think that Azir doesn't need a new skin for a long time, he has just had SKT and Warring Kingdoms quite recently, now he has a good number of skins, and every one of them is really good quality, so its time for him to step down and let the new skins go to champs who need them.
According to Riot, Team skins do not contribute to the champion's skin line but you are right that Azir just received a new skin

Thats true, and it wouldn't really be fair to count them, considering there is heavy restrictions on what champs/colours/themes the skin line has to include 

But wether its officially recognised or not, its still 2 very real, very playable skins, and in my opinion giving him a 3rd is just using up time that could be spent giving Yorick or Aurelion Sol a new skin. 
Although its a shame that both the new ones are legacy :( so a lot of people wont get to enjoy them :/

anyway, speaking of new skins, how are you finding that new talon one? ;)
I can see him working an rts theme, but the arcade theme just doesn't seem right for him though.

I agree that there would be more fitting themes for him than Arcade. _(itll never happen, but trump/president Azir would be perfect)_
But he does kinda feel like a 'boss'. Its not a huge stretch to imagine him in blue/purple armour, with green pixel trails coming from his arms, and 2D soldiers (like final boss veigar's joke).

But yea, there are themes that would fit him better than arcade.
